description: Conservation biology focuses on the study of biological diversity. Students examine why we
should be concerned about the number and types of species on earth, what factors threaten the
survival of species and how we can conserve them. Using principles of ecology and evolution,
with input from other disciplines, students gain a better understanding of the impact of humans
on biodiversity and the importance of responsible environmental decision-making.  Counts
toward major and concentration: Environmental Studies.  Offered annually.
